intro: Bulbocodium cameroonianum, commonly known as the Cameroon bulbocodium, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It has a bulbous root system that stores nutrients, aiding in its survival in its native habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its environment.
